CLUE: Arab or Muslim at time of the Crusades
OUTPUT: ['The region was home to a large number of Arabic-speaking peoples, who were predominantly Sunni Muslims.', 'Muhammad ibn Abd al-Rahman - Also known as Al-Murtada, he was the grandson of the Prophet Muhammad and a prominent leader during the early years of Islam.', 'Ali ibn Abi Talib - A cousin and son-in-law of the Prophet Muhammad, Ali was a prominent leader in the early Muslim community and is revered by Shia Muslims as the first Imam.', 'Saladin - A Kurdish general who led the Muslim armies against the Crusaders during the Fifth Crusade (1213-1219), Saladin was known for his military prowess and strategic thinking.', 'Baybars - A Mamluk sultan who ruled Egypt from 1261 to 1277, Baybars led the Muslim armies against the Crusaders during the Seventh Crusade (1248-1254).', 'Al-Salih Ayyub - The Sultan of Egypt and Syria from 1240 to 1249, Al-Salih Ayyub led the Muslim armies against the Crusaders during the Seventh Crusade (1248-1254).', 'Baibars al-Bunduqdi - A Mamluk general who fought against the Crusaders during the Fifth Crusade (1213-1219), Baibars was known for his bravery and military prowess.', 'Qalawun al-Bani Walid - A Mamluk sultan who ruled Egypt from 1280 to 1290, Qalawun led the Muslim armies against the Crusaders during the Seventh Crusade (1248-1254).', 'An-Nasir Dawud - A Mamluk sultan who ruled Egypt from 1220 to 1237, An-Nasir Dawud led the Muslim armies against the Crusaders during the Sixth Crusade (1228-1229).', 'Al-Kamil - A Kurdish sultan who ruled Egypt and Syria from 1218 to 1238, Al-Kamil led the Muslim armies against the Crusaders during the Seventh Crusade (1248-1254).', 'Baybars al-Mansur - A Mamluk sultan who ruled Egypt from 1260 to 1277, Baybars led the Muslim armies against the Crusaders during the Seventh Crusade (1248-1254).', 'There were many other leaders and soldiers who played important roles in the conflicts between the two sides.']
